Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic administrative text on recto (2 ll., vertical fibres) and verso (4 ll., horizontal fibres). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Receipt of tax of 1/10 on sales paid by Teianti(?) daughter of Zeho in respect of two houses. On verso, details of the payment in 3 instalments. Date. year 9 Tybi of Ptol. Philadelphus = BC. 276. Feb. 28-Mar. 29 [...] The tax payer is known from P. dem. Rylands xii.xiii". Nos.10522-10532 and 10535-10537 belonging to the same archive, cf. P. BM EA 10522.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.88) (sited in note 5 as comparison, dated: 276 BC)
Glanville 1939 / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum I: A Theban Archive of the Reign of Ptolemy I, Soter (p.xlvi, 43-4, pl.2, 11)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43769) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43769)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured Black ink Supported locally: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
